generics.Name: Name
generics.error try again: An error has occurred, please try again
generics.error edit patient description: If the problem persists, edit the patient description
generics.sorry cant anwser1: We've detected content in your text that may not align with our internal policies. We kindly ask you to review and adjust the text you've provided. If the problem persists, kindly consider revisiting us another day while we work on enhancing the experience. You're also welcome to provide an alternative description. For immediate assistance, please reach out to our dedicated support team at support@foundation29.org. We sincerely apologize for any inconvenience caused. Please remember the importance of adhering to our usage guidelines to maintain access to our tool.
generics.sorry cant anwser2: We can't answer that right now. Please try another day to give us time to fix it. In the meantime, you can select another option. If you need immediate help, please write to our support team: support@foundation29.org We apologize for the inconvenience.
generics.sorry cant anwser3: The maximum length is 8000 characters. Please reduce the length of the description.
generics.excessCharacters: The maximum length is 8000 characters. You have exceeded by {{excessCharacters}} characters. Please reduce the length of the description.
generics.Translation error: There has been an error with the translation service, please modify the patient's description and try again.
generics.errorQuestionType: The question type is invalid. Please check the question and try again.
generics.errorDiseaseName: The disease name format is invalid. Please check the disease name and try again.
generics.minDescriptionLength: The description must be at least 100 characters to perform an accurate analysis.
generics.unsupported language: Sorry, the language in which you have written the patient's description is not supported. Please write the patient's description in another language.
generics.textTooLongOptions: For better results, a text between 2000 and 3000 characters is recommended. What would you like to do?
generics.textTooLongMaxMessage: The text exceeds 8000 characters. You must shorten it manually or use AI to summarize it.
generics.recommendedLength: Recommended: max. 2000-3000 characters for better results.
generics.aiSummaryWarning: Note: AI-generated summaries may contain errors and should be carefully reviewed.
generics.textTooLongMaxModel: The text exceeds the maximum limit of 400,000 characters allowed by the model. Please significantly shorten the text to continue.

diagnosis.Click on the disease to see more options: Click on the disease to see more options. For example, make differential diagnosis.
diagnosis.advise: Please note that suggested diagnoses are generated using an advanced language-based artificial intelligence model and may contain errors.
diagnosis.SponsorMsg: Learn more about the disease here
diagnosis.correctly anonymized: The text has been correctly anonymized
diagnosis.not detected personal information: We have not detected any personal information in the clinical description you have entered.
diagnosis.detected personal information: We have detected personal information in the clinical description you have entered.
diagnosis.proceeded to delete: We have proceeded to delete this information and save the anonymized text.
diagnosis.We have processed your inputs: We have processed your inputs and generated a summary
diagnosis.Please review the text: Please review the text in the main box before proceeding with the search
diagnosis.errorAnalyze: Error analyzing the information. Please try again.
diagnosis.Analyze uploaded files and search for di: Analyze uploaded files and search for diagnoses

policy.p2.1: 1. Who we are and how to contact us
policy.p2.2: Fundación 29 de Febrero ("DxGPT", "we", "our", "us") is the data controller for the personal data processed through the DxGPT platform, and, as a non-profit organisation, we prioritise privacy and actively advocate for the responsible handling of patient data.
policy.p2.5: Regulatory status — not a medical device
policy.p2.6: DxGPT is not a medical device under EU MDR, U.S. FDA, or other applicable regulations. It is provided solely as a clinical decision support tool to assist qualified healthcare professionals. It must not be relied upon as a substitute for professional medical judgment, diagnosis, or treatment.
policy.p3.3: Age, gender, symptoms, and other details you enter when requesting diagnostic suggestions.
policy.p3.4: Feedback, survey responses, or support queries (email address, message content).
policy.p3.6: Health-related information you submit is considered special category personal data under Article 9 GDPR and Protected Health Information (PHI) under the U.S. Health Insurance Portability and Accountability Act (HIPAA).
policy.p3.8: IP address, cookies, browser type, operating system, device identifiers.
policy.p3.9: Usage statistics processed by trusted analytics partners to improve usability.
policy.p4.4: Provide diagnostic suggestions and core features
policy.p4.6: Process health data you voluntarily provide
policy.p4.8: Improve, secure, and debug the service
policy.p4.10: Comply with legal obligations (e.g., fraud prevention, regulatory requests)
policy.p5.2: Deliver personalised diagnostic suggestions and related functionality.
policy.p5.3: Respond to feedback and support enquiries.
policy.p5.4: Analyse aggregated usage to refine algorithms and user experience.
policy.p5.5: Enforce our terms of service and protect the security of the platform.
policy.p5.6: DxGPT will never sell, rent, or share your personal data—or any data whatsoever—with third parties for marketing or any other purpose. This commitment is permanent and irreversible, and, because we strip individual identifiers at the source and store only masked data, such sharing is technically infeasible.
policy.p5.7: We may, however, disclose aggregated, fully anonymised usage statistics that cannot be traced back to any individual user.
policy.p6.2: Encryption in transit and at rest protects all data channels.
policy.p6.3: An AI-based detection system automatically identifies personal identifiers and replaces them with asterisks (***) before storage.
policy.p6.4: No unmasked health data is ever written to disk; processing occurs only in volatile memory.
policy.p6.5: Technical and organisational measures follow ISO 27001 and NIST SP 800-88 standards.
policy.p6.6: Access is limited to authorised personnel under strict confidentiality.
policy.p6.7: HIPAA compliance — DxGPT complies with HIPAA (Privacy, Security, and Breach Notification Rules) and executes Business Associate Agreements (BAAs). See Appendix A for detailed safeguards.
policy.p7.2: Aggregated, anonymous usage data is retained for no longer than 5 years before irreversible deletion.
policy.p7.3: Support tickets and contractual records are stored for up to 5 years to comply with accounting and legal requirements.
policy.p7.4: You may request earlier deletion where GDPR permits (see section 8).
policy.p8.2: Whenever possible, your data is processed in the geographic region closest to you to minimise latency and respect local jurisdiction.
policy.p8.3: For users located in the European Economic Area (EEA), all personal data is stored and processed exclusively on servers physically located within the European Union.
policy.p8.4: Where processing occurs outside the EEA, we rely on Standard Contractual Clauses (SCCs) or adequacy decisions to ensure an adequate level of protection (Art. 46 GDPR). In light of the CJEU Schrems II decision, we also implement supplementary technical and organisational measures such as end-to-end encryption, strict access controls, and detailed audit logging to minimise the risk of unlawful government access.
policy.p9.3: Access the personal data we hold about you (Art. 15).
policy.p9.5: Erase your data ("right to be forgotten", Art. 17).
policy.p9.7: Object to processing based on legitimate interests (Art. 21).
policy.p9.8: Data portability—receive your data in a structured, machine-readable format (Art. 20).
policy.p9.9: Withdraw consent at any time, without affecting prior lawful processing.
policy.p9.10: Lodge a complaint with your local supervisory authority.
policy.p10.1: 9. Exercising your rights and contacting us
policy.p10.2: To exercise any of the rights above or raise a privacy concern, contact our DPO at privacy@foundation29.org or write to the address in section 1.
policy.p10.3: We aim to respond to all legitimate requests within one calendar month. Complex requests may take up to two additional months, in which case we will let you know.
policy.p11.2: We may update this privacy policy periodically. Significant changes will be announced within the DxGPT interface or via email. The "Last updated" date at the top of this page indicates when revisions were made.
policy.p12.2: Privacy Rule — protected health information (PHI) is used or disclosed only as permitted or with explicit patient authorization and adheres to the minimum necessary principle.
policy.p12.3: Security Rule — administrative, physical, and technical safeguards such as encryption at rest, role-based access controls, audit logs, and regular risk assessments protect electronic PHI.
policy.p12.4: Breach Notification Rule — if a breach involving PHI occurs, we notify affected individuals and the U.S. Department of Health & Human Services without undue delay and no later than 60 days after discovery.
policy.p12.5: Business Associate Agreements (BAAs) — we execute BAAs with every vendor that handles PHI on our behalf, contractually requiring them to apply equivalent HIPAA-level safeguards.
policy.Foundation 29: © 2025 Fundación 29 de Febrero. All rights reserved.

policyShort.p1.1: DxGPT is run by Fundación 29 de Febrero.
policyShort.p1.2: Email our Data Protection Officer (DPO) at privacy@foundation29.org.
policyShort.p1.4: Not a medical device — DxGPT only helps doctors think about possible diagnoses. It does not replace a real doctor.
policyShort.p2.1: You give us: age, gender, symptoms, feedback, and your email if you write to us.
policyShort.p2.2: Sensitive info: health details you type in.
policyShort.p2.3: We collect automatically: your IP address, cookies, the kind of phone or computer you use, and how you use the app.
policyShort.p3.1: To run the app and give you health ideas.
policyShort.p3.2: To make the app safer and better.
policyShort.p3.3: Because some laws require us to keep certain records.
policyShort.p4: 4. What we do with your data
policyShort.p4.1: Give you suggestions and answer your questions.
policyShort.p4.2: Protect the app from bugs and attacks.
policyShort.p4.3: We never sell or rent your data. We might share overall numbers (no names) to show how the app is used.
policyShort.p5.1: We lock data with strong encryption.
policyShort.p5.2: An AI system hides your name and other personal details with *** before saving anything.
policyShort.p5.3: Strict rules limit who can see the data.
policyShort.p6.2: Support emails and payment notes: up to 5 years (legal rule).
policyShort.p7.1: If you live in Europe, your data stays on servers inside the EU.
policyShort.p7.2: If data moves elsewhere, we use special contracts and strong encryption so it stays protected.
policyShort.p8.7: Change your mind and take back your consent.
policyShort.p9.1: Email privacy@foundation29.org. We reply within 1 month (or tell you if we need more time).
policyShort.p10.1: If we change this policy, we will tell you in the app or by email.

support.Subject: Subject
support.Uploading a capture can help us a lot: Uploading a capture can help us a lot

footer.Dx29info: DxGPT is a search and reference tool provided for informational purposes and not intended to replace the clinician's judgement or experience. It should not be used to diagnose or treat medical conditions.

land.disclaimer:
DxGPT is a research experiment using a general purpose artificial intelligence. Specifically, it uses OpenAI's GPT-4 linguistic model as a predictive model for a tool to provide information on related rare diseases. It is designed to provide general information and suggestions based on the symptoms provided. The tool is not intended to replace professional medical advice, or support diagnosis, prevention, monitoring, prediction or treatment and should never be used to make diagnostic judgments for real patients.

Because AI can give variable results, diagnostic accuracy and suggestions from the tool may vary, so it is important to consult a qualified healthcare professional to ensure an accurate and appropriate diagnosis. Use of this tool is at the user's own risk and Foundation 29 is not responsible for any consequences or damages that may result from its use.

By using this tool, the user acknowledges that he/she has read and understood this disclaimer, and accepts any potential risks associated with the use of the artificial intelligence-based tool.
land.Recommendations: For best results, indicate when and why you think the symptoms appeared
land.required: Please provide patient details (age, gender, symptoms) and when they began. Example: Female, 42 years old, severe headaches for 3 months, dizziness, family history of migraines.
land.searchFile: You can also upload a complete report. This functionality is in testing and may give unexpected results. DxGPT will suggest the diagnosis that the model considers most appropriate for that patient. In order to be respectful of the data protection law we do not store personal patient data and the data is deleted at the end of this session. We would be interested in your feedback for future developments.
land.error extension: The uploaded file must have a .pdf, .docx extension, or image files

land.p1.1: The patient is thirteen months old. First focal seizure at three months. Multiple tonic-clonic seizures. Febrile seizures. One status epilepticus at eight months.
land.p1.2: Girl. 11 years. unilateral hemispheric atrophy, associated with drug-resistant focal epilepsy, progressive hemiplegia, and cognitive decline

aboutUs.p0.1: Medical diagnosis, particularly in the context of rare diseases, is often a complex and time-consuming process. Clinicians must evaluate a wide array of symptoms, analyze the patient's medical history, and interpret test results, all of which can complicate the path to an accurate diagnosis. This complexity can lead to delays in initiating the correct treatment and create uncertainty in clinical decision-making.
aboutUs.p0.2: Rare diseases pose an even greater challenge, as many healthcare professionals lack direct experience with these conditions due to their infrequency. With over 10,000 identified rare diseases, most of which are unfamiliar to the average clinician, the diagnostic process becomes especially daunting. In this context, the use of advanced technology to support diagnosis is no longer a luxury—it is a necessity. Having access to intelligent tools that assist in generating possible diagnoses is essential to enhance diagnostic accuracy and improve the overall quality of care.
aboutUs.p1.1: DxGPT leverages cutting-edge language models—such as GPT-4, developed by OpenAI—to assist in the diagnostic process. By default, it utilizes the GPT-4 model, and also integrates advanced reasoning models like o1 and o3 for even greater diagnostic precision. When a healthcare professional inputs a patient's symptoms, DxGPT analyzes the information and generates a list of likely diagnoses.
aboutUs.p1.2: This approach represents a paradigm shift in the design and implementation of diagnostic tools. Instead of depending on static, rule-based systems, DxGPT applies the contextual reasoning capabilities of large language and reasoning models to better emulate the clinical decision-making process. This allows it to adapt to complex cases and rare disease presentations more effectively.
aboutUs.p1.3: While DxGPT does not replace the expertise of medical professionals, it acts as a powerful cognitive aid—helping clinicians focus their investigations and significantly reduce the time required to arrive at an accurate diagnosis.
aboutUs.p2.1: When a healthcare professional inputs a patient's symptoms into DxGPT, the platform constructs a detailed prompt that is sent to a large language model (LLM). This prompt includes not only the patient's clinical presentation but also specific alignment instructions that guide the LLM to produce consistent and medically relevant responses. The LLM—whether GPT-4 or a reasoning-optimized model like o1 or o3—then processes the prompt and generates a list of potential diagnoses.
aboutUs.p2.2: The generated response is parsed and formatted into a clear, easy-to-interpret interface, helping clinicians quickly review the most likely diagnostic hypotheses. This structured output serves as a valuable starting point for further investigation, which may include reviewing medical history, ordering diagnostic tests, and gathering additional clinical information. User feedback is integral to refining the models and improving both the accuracy and usability of DxGPT over time.
aboutUs.p3.1: DxGPT is currently an experimental platform—not a production tool. Its primary objective is to explore and evaluate the capabilities of large language models (LLMs) in the complex task of medical diagnosis, particularly for rare diseases. We aim to understand how these models can support clinicians, identify their limitations, and assess their real-world applicability.
aboutUs.p3.2: We are continuously developing new features and improving our methodologies based on rigorous testing and feedback. Collaboration is central to our mission, and we actively seek to partner with researchers, clinicians, and institutions interested in advancing the science of AI-assisted diagnostics. If you're interested in collaborating on this experimental journey, please reach out to us.
aboutUs.p4: In our pursuit of transparency and collaboration, we have made the source code of DxGPT publicly available. As a non-profit organization, Foundation 29 relies on donations to develop tools like DxGPT, which are offered entirely free of charge. Our research and results are open to the public, reflecting our commitment to returning value to society. You can explore and contribute to our client and server repositories on GitHub. We believe that open science and community-driven innovation are key to advancing diagnostics and addressing the challenges of rare diseases.
aboutUs.p5.1: The Hospital Sant Joan de Déu The Hospital Sant Joan de Déu has conducted a comprehensive clinical study evaluating the diagnostic performance of DxGPT compared to highly qualified medical professionals, across both common and rare diseases. The results indicate that DxGPT achieves a diagnostic accuracy comparable to that of expert clinicians. This work has been published as a preprint and is currently under review for publication in a peer-reviewed scientific journal. The study also includes the most recent results from our evaluations of cutting-edge language and reasoning models, providing key insights into the evolving capabilities of these technologies in clinical settings.
aboutUs.p5.3: Evaluation of the Clinical Utility of DxGPT | medRxiv
aboutUs.p6.1: Rigorous evaluations ensure that AI-based diagnostic tools are suitable for real-world clinical use.
aboutUs.p6.2: DxGPT, built on advanced large language models, has shown strong performance in diagnosing rare diseases using real clinical case data. In particular, the clinical evaluation of reasoning-focused models has demonstrated that DxGPT can surpass the diagnostic accuracy of medical specialists when it comes to rare diseases—a domain where even experienced professionals often face limitations due to lack of familiarity and data scarcity.
aboutUs.p6.3: These results highlight the transformative potential of AI in supporting healthcare professionals, especially in complex or low-prevalence scenarios. Continued assessment and refinement are underway to ensure reliability, transparency, and alignment with clinical standards.
aboutUs.fp1: DxGPT is still in development and intended as a decision support tool, not a replacement for professional medical judgment. Further validation on real clinical data and comparison with human expert diagnoses are necessary.
aboutUs.fp2: Foundation 29 has extensive experience in regulatory compliance and ensures that all developments, including DxGPT, align with current data protection and AI governance frameworks. We actively comply with GDPR and HIPAA standards for data privacy and are working toward full alignment with the European Union's AI Act. We collaborate with regulatory bodies in Spain and across Europe to ensure that our tools meet the highest standards for ethical, legal, and clinical safety.
aboutUs.fp3: We are actively working with hospitals and conducting studies to validate and improve DxGPT. New findings will be shared on our GitHub and MedRxiv.
aboutUs.fs1: Due to the high demand for DxGPT, we are building systems to better manage user feedback, requests, and suggestions. These improvements will help us scale our support and enhance the platform with your input.
aboutUs.tp1: We would like to express our sincere gratitude to Microsoft, our strategic technology partner. Through the AI for Good program, Microsoft has generously provided us with an Azure grant that covers the computational infrastructure required to power DxGPT. This support has been essential to developing and scaling our experimental platform.
aboutUs.tp2: We are also deeply thankful for the invaluable collaboration of Microsoft employees who have contributed their time and expertise as volunteers. Their commitment and pro bono contributions have significantly advanced our mission, and we are proud to count them among our collaborators in using technology to improve healthcare.
aboutUs.tp3: We are also grateful to Google for its generous support through its NGO assistance program. Google has provided a grant that allows us to use its advertising services to increase awareness and visibility of DxGPT. This has played a key role in helping us reach healthcare professionals and patients who can benefit from AI-supported diagnostic tools.
aboutUs.p7: Foundation 29 is a non-profit organization committed to improving the lives of people living with rare and chronic diseases. Inspired by World Rare Disease Day, celebrated on February 29, we use data and digital tools to promote earlier diagnoses, empower patients, and support healthcare professionals. Through collaboration with hospitals, researchers, and the broader medical community, we aim to make healthcare more personalized, inclusive, and effective. Our initiatives are built on open science, transparency, and the belief that data can drive positive change in healthcare systems worldwide.
aboutUs.p8: We extend our heartfelt gratitude to our generous sponsors whose altruistic support is vital to our mission. Their contributions are purely philanthropic, with no commercial interests or data sharing involved.
aboutUs.p9.1: If you are interested in becoming a sponsor or collaborating with us, please contact us. Together, we can continue to build a healthier future for everyone.
aboutUs.implementationText1: DxGPT is being implemented in various public healthcare systems to help primary care physicians improve the diagnosis of rare diseases.
aboutUs.implementationText2: Below are some examples of our current and developing implementations:

sermas.title: Madrid Health Service (SERMAS)
sermas.text: Since September 2023, the Madrid Health Service (SERMAS) has been a pioneer in implementing DxGPT for more than 6,000 Primary Care physicians in the Community of Madrid. This initiative has improved the accuracy and speed in diagnosing rare diseases, significantly reducing the time needed to refer patients to appropriate specialists.
sermas.news1: Madrid Health Service, a pioneer in applying Generative Artificial Intelligence to improve diagnosis for patients with rare diseases
sermas.news2: The Community of Madrid enables access for more than 6,000 Primary Care physicians to AI for the diagnosis of rare diseases

catsalut.title: CatSalut (Catalonia)
catsalut.text: We are currently working to implement DxGPT in the Catalan health system (CatSalut), with the aim of bringing this innovative tool to healthcare professionals in Catalonia to improve the diagnosis of rare diseases in the region.

faqs.title: Frequently Asked Questions
faqs.q1: Is my medical information kept confidential?
faqs.a1: Yes, your privacy is our highest priority. DxGPT is an initiative by Foundation 29, a non-profit organization committed to rigorously protecting your personal and health data. We never sell, rent, or share your personal information with third parties for commercial or marketing purposes. All data you provide is securely encrypted both during transmission and when stored. Additionally, sensitive details are anonymized automatically before being saved, ensuring individual identities cannot be revealed. Access to your data is strictly controlled and limited to authorized personnel who adhere to strict confidentiality obligations, fully complying with GDPR and HIPAA regulations.
faqs.q2: Can I use DxGPT in emergency situations?
faqs.a2: No, DxGPT is not intended or designed to handle medical emergencies or urgent medical conditions. In the event of an emergency, please immediately contact your local emergency services or visit the nearest emergency facility. DxGPT is developed as a supportive resource for medical professionals, aiming to enhance diagnostic processes and decision-making. However, it must never be considered a substitute for the professional judgment and immediate intervention provided by trained medical personnel.
faqs.q3: How does DxGPT suggest possible diagnoses?
faqs.a3: DxGPT utilizes advanced artificial intelligence and machine learning models to analyze the symptoms and clinical information provided by healthcare professionals. It compares this input against an extensive database of existing medical knowledge to suggest potential conditions. DxGPT is explicitly not a medical device; rather, it operates as a decision-support system. This means it aids medical professionals by providing guidance on potential diagnoses but does not replace their expert clinical judgment or professional assessments. The suggestions DxGPT provides are intended to assist clinicians in identifying possible diagnoses and directing further investigation, but it is essential always to consult a qualified healthcare professional for a definitive diagnosis and treatment plan.
faqs.q4: Can I speak with a human doctor through DxGPT?
faqs.a4: At present, DxGPT is entirely automated and does not facilitate direct communication with human doctors or medical personnel. For any specific health-related concerns or detailed medical consultations, please contact your regular healthcare provider or seek professional medical advice directly.
faqs.a5: Yes, DxGPT is accessible to users worldwide. However, it's important to note that medical practices, terminology, and healthcare standards can significantly vary between countries and regions. DxGPT aims to provide universally applicable information, but users should always interpret its suggestions within the context of their local medical standards and practices.
faqs.q6: What languages can I use with DxGPT?
faqs.a6: DxGPT can process inputs and provide responses in virtually any language. However, because its training data was predominantly in English, responses in English typically offer the highest accuracy and reliability. For languages with fewer users or less available medical training data, DxGPT's suggestions might occasionally be less accurate or incomplete. We strongly encourage you to use DxGPT in your preferred or native language and provide feedback about your experience. This will help us continuously improve its capabilities and accuracy across different languages.
faqs.q7: How often is DxGPT's medical information updated?
faqs.a7: DxGPT itself does not directly update its internal database or knowledge. Instead, our dedicated team continually tests and evaluates the latest and most advanced artificial intelligence models and algorithms. We regularly conduct clinical studies in partnership with hospitals and medical institutions to verify and enhance DxGPT's performance, particularly focusing on accurately diagnosing rare diseases and complex cases. This ongoing process ensures DxGPT remains current and effective.
faqs.q8: How can I provide feedback on DxGPT?
faqs.a8: Your feedback is critically important for the continuous improvement of DxGPT. You can conveniently submit feedback directly through the application using the red tab located on the right side of the DxGPT interface. Alternatively, you can reach us via email at support@foundation29.org. We carefully review all feedback and suggestions to enhance our service.
faqs.q9: Can I see statistics on how DxGPT is used?
faqs.a9: Yes, you can access comprehensive statistics through the 'Usage Statistics' section located in the top menu of the DxGPT interface. Here, you can find detailed insights such as the total number of users, most frequently entered symptoms, top suggested diagnoses, geographic distribution of users, and a summary of user feedback. These statistics are presented anonymously and do not contain any personally identifiable information.
faqs.q10: Who can collaborate on DxGPT's development?
faqs.a10: We actively seek and warmly welcome collaborations from researchers, medical professionals, healthcare institutions, and organizations interested in the advancement of AI-assisted diagnostic technologies. If you are interested in contributing to our project or exploring joint research opportunities, please reach out to us via email at support@foundation29.org, or complete the contact form available on our official website. Collaboration helps us continually enhance DxGPT's capabilities and practical utility.
faqs.q11: I represent a patient group. How can we collaborate with DxGPT?
faqs.a11: If you represent a patient group or advocacy organization, we encourage you to collaborate by promoting DxGPT within your networks and communities. We are particularly interested in your group's experiences with specific medical conditions or diseases, as this information helps us better understand your unique needs and refine DxGPT accordingly. Please contact us to discuss potential collaboration and how DxGPT might best support your patient group.
faqs.q12: Is DxGPT considered a medical device?
faqs.a12: No. DxGPT is not classified or regulated as a medical device under international regulations such as the European Union's Medical Device Regulation (EU MDR) or the U.S. Food and Drug Administration (FDA). DxGPT serves purely as an experimental clinical decision-support tool, designed exclusively to assist qualified healthcare professionals by providing guidance and suggestions for diagnosis. It should always be used alongside, and not in replacement of, professional medical evaluation.
faqs.a13: Yes, DxGPT is entirely free to use. It is developed and maintained as a non-profit project by Foundation 29, funded through philanthropic donations, grants, and collaborative partnerships. We aim to make advanced AI diagnostic support tools freely available to healthcare professionals and patients globally, promoting equity and access in medical diagnostics.
faqs.q14: Is my data used for secondary use?
faqs.a14: DxGPT never uses your personal data for secondary purposes such as marketing or commercial activities. We strictly use aggregated, anonymous data—including general usage patterns, frequently reported symptoms, common diagnostic suggestions, and overall trends—to enhance our algorithms' accuracy, reliability, and functionality. This aggregated data is completely anonymized and ensures that no individual user can be identified from this information.

timeline.title: We are going to help you build a timeline of your symptoms. This data can improve your disease management and help other patients like you on their diagnostic odyssey. There are 2 easy steps:
timeline.subtitlea: In this report, the DxGPT user describes the patient's symptoms with the aim of improving patient-physician communication.
timeline.subtitleb: It is recommended to take the report to the next medical visit so that both the patient and the physician can help to further
timeline.subtitle1: This report has been generated with DxGPT, a diagnostic assistance tool through precision symptom description
timeline.subtitle2: developed by Foundation 29 of February (www.foundation29.org). Together we accelerate the process of diagnosis
timeline.subtitle3: of rare diseases and their treatment in an easy and simple way.
timeline.footer1: We are a non-profit organisation that designs and creates tools for patients to manage their own data, revolutionising the
timeline.footer2: diagnosis and management of rare diseases. We empower patients and doctors to use their medical data or their benefit and that
timeline.footer3: of the community. We believe there is a better way to do things centred on the patient and their data.
timeline.footer6: For any questions or queries, please contact us at

cookie.message: This Application uses cookies to ensure you get the best experience on our Application.

cookies.title: Cookies policy
cookies.p1.1: Foundation 29 recognises the importance of the applicable legislation and regulations pertaining to privacy and data protection. In this sense, the protection of the safety, integrity and confidentiality of our clients' and users' information is very important to us and we therefore strive to act responsibly in this regard. This page describes our web's (hereinafter, the web) cookies policy https://dxgpt.app (hereinafter the web).
cookies.p1.2: The provisions of both the Legal Notice and the Privacy policy will apply for the purpose of this cookies policy.
cookies.p2.1: As specified in the first layer ('banner on cookies'), the User has accepted or is able to accept this cookies policy. The use of technical means to prevent cookies from being downloaded to the user's browser does not invalidate the consent given for legal purposes, although the technical result may be that some or none of the cookies will not be downloaded, the effects of which are described later in this cookies policy.
cookies.p3.1: Foundation 29 uses cookies to make the browsing of its web more functional and useful for its users. In this sense, and to give the User all the information necessary for correct browsing, we provide the following explanatory text on what cookies are and how the User can disable them.
cookies.p4.1: All websites (regardless of the service they provide) currently use cookies, i.e. they save minimal information about the User's activity on the website. A cookie can therefore be defined as a small text file or generalised device downloaded onto the User's device or machine when they are browsing websites with the aim of storing data that may be updated and retrieved by the organisation responsible for their installation.
cookies.t5: 5. Purposes, management of cookies and type of cookies
cookies.p5.1: Technical cookies: These cookies allow the User to browse a web page, platform or application and to use the different options or services provided, such as monitoring traffic and data reporting, identification of session, access to restricted sections, using safety features during browsing, storing content for the streaming of videos or sound or sharing content via the social media.
cookies.p5.2: Analytical cookies: These cookies allow the person responsible for them to monitor and analyse the behaviour of users on the websites to which they are linked. The information collected through this type of cookies is used to measure the activity of the websites, application or platform and to generate browsing profiles of the users of these sites, applications and platforms in order to make improvements based on the analysis of the usage data of the users of the service.
cookies.p5.2.1: Google Analytics: it used to distinguish users.
cookies.p5.2.2: Hotjar: it is used to record the user's navigation through the elements of the web.
cookies.p5.3: The web does not use personalization cookies, advertising cookies or behavioral advertising cookies.
cookies.p6.1: Users can disable cookies from the preferences section on their Internet browser. Here are some links provided by the most popular browsers, with instructions for managing cookies on different devices and versions, if required.

testimonials.title: Testimonials from our users
testimonials.testi1: I am convinced that this application can simplify the complexity of the healthcare process, without affecting the quality of care, which is the great challenge of any technological solution when approaching the healthcare world. Moreover, as the application is completely free, any healthcare professional or patient can use it regardless of the economic implications and without compromising the privacy and security of its users.
testimonials.testi2: A good assistant that complements our capacity for differential diagnosis, especially in those patients with less prevalent diseases, where it is not always possible to keep in mind all the diagnostic possibilities that make up a given conjunction of symptoms, signs and complementary tests.
testimonials.testi3: This tool is truly exceptional. It delivers precise and accurate information, which is immensely valuable. What sets it apart is its capability to suggest additional symptoms crucial for diagnosis. It doesn't provide any misleading or biased information. I'm thoroughly impressed by its accuracy and helpfulness. Highly recommended for anyone seeking reliable diagnostic support.
testimonials.testi4: This is wonderful!! It would have taken HOURS to give all of my info to a doctor to even start on a diagnosis. I've suspected MS for a little while now, and it was the top possibility. Really, thank you for this!!.
testimonials.testi5: Loved it, I am not an MD so I am aware of the limitations but still found it to be incredibly intuitive and it was quite helpful for a non medical professional to gain insight… Excellent APP.
testimonials.Julio Mayol: Julio Mayol, specialist in surgery at Hospital Clínico San Carlos (Spain)
testimonials.Juanjo Ríos: Juanjo Ríos, medical director of Hospital La Paz (Spain)

termsform.terms: terms of use of the form data
termsform.acceptterms: You must accept the terms to continue.
termsform.modalTitle: Terms of use of form data
termsform.modalBody2: By submitting the form, you agree that DxGPT may use your contact information (email) for the following purposes:
termsform.modalBody4: Respond to your inquiries and support requests.
termsform.modalBody6: Inform you about new versions, updates, and improvements of the DxGPT software.
termsform.modalBody8: Request your feedback to improve the quality and functionality of the software.
termsform.modalBody10: Your personal information will be treated with the utmost confidentiality and will not be shared with third parties without your express consent.
termsform.modalBody11: We implement appropriate technical and organizational measures to protect your personal data against unauthorized access, loss, or destruction.
termsform.modalBody13: You have the right to access, rectify, and delete your personal data. To exercise these rights, you can contact us at support@foundation29.org.
termsform.modalBody14: You can revoke your consent for the use of your data at any time by sending us a request to support@foundation29.org.
termsform.modalBody16: If you have any questions about these terms, please do not hesitate to contact us: support@foundation29.org.
